thread.title: The Visit: How Aussies Olivia DeJonge and Ed Oxenbould survived their scary roles | DailyTelegraph
thread.title_full: The Visit: How Aussies Olivia DeJonge and Ed Oxenbould survived their scary roles | DailyTelegraph

author: Neala Johnson
title: The Visit: How Aussies Olivia DeJonge and Ed Oxenbould survived their scary roles | DailyTelegraph
text:
“I GET on them hard,” infamous filmmaker M. Night Shyamalan says ominously. “I literally will pound them. They’ll tell you .”
The writer/director of The Sixth Sense, Signs and Lady in the Water is referring to Aussie actors Olivia DeJonge, 17, and Ed Oxenbould, 14. The youngsters star as sister and brother in The Visit — a comedic horror thriller that is being hailed as Shyamalan’s return to form.
That he cast two Australians, says Shyamalan, was a “total fluke”. The pair hadn’t met previously, says Perth girl DeJonge, but “clicked as soon as we met each other”. Which was helpful, given Shyamalan’s exacting standards.
Tyler (Oxenbould) and his big sister spend a weird, scary week with the grandparents they never knew (Peter McRobbie and Deanna Dunagan) in movie The Visit. Picture: Universal
Feels real ... DeJonge had to tell herself The Visit was “just a movie!” Picture: Universal
Taxing role ... Oxenbould with writer-director on the Philadelphia set of The Visit. Picture: Universal
... and living out that No Good, Very Bad Day. Picture: Disney
Previous life ... Oxenbould with his Alexander and the Terrible, Horrible ... parents Jennifer Garner and Steve Carell. Picture: Disney
1 of n
